Articles.Content: Crewed vessels have a useful radar altimeter but computer-piloted ones does not and this is a glaring issue for me landing sometimes with limited fuel.
This is a feature that's missing from KSP. It's very even better if it shows an AGL altitude readout in third person.

It was the first mod I went looking for back in the day!

http://mods.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/220529-kdata

It has been suggested on other threads that AGL be the default altitude displayed when in 'surface' mode.  This to me is a good solution.  In the meantime I will use KER to show that.

I find the stock 'vertical speed indicator' dial next to the altitude display perfectly adequate and easy to read.

2 hours ago, pandaman said:

It has been suggested on other threads that AGL be the default altitude displayed when in 'surface' mode.

So much this. This mod implements the ideal behavior for me, and as a bonus calculates altitude from the lowest part rather than the root.
Radar altitude also makes so much more technical sense; really, the sea-level gauge should only work on worlds with an atmosphere. (they rely on a pressure reading)
